member.name: CREDENTIAL_ATTRIBUTE
member.summary: The CREDENTIAL_ATTRIBUTE structure contains an application-defined attribute of the credential. An attribute is a keyword-value pair. It is up to the application to define the meaning of the attribute.

summary.para: Name of the application-specific attribute. Names should be of the form <CompanyName>_<Name>.
This member cannot be longer than CRED_MAX_STRING_LENGTH (256) characters.

member.name: CREDENTIAL_ATTRIBUTE.Flags
member.summary: Identifies characteristics of the credential attribute. This member is reserved and should be originally initialized as zero and not otherwise altered to permit future enhancement.

member.name: CREDENTIAL_ATTRIBUTE.ValueSize
member.summary: Length of Value in bytes. This member cannot be larger than CRED_MAX_VALUE_SIZE (256).

summary.para: Data associated with the attribute. By convention, if Value is a text string, then Value should not include the trailing zero character and should be in UNICODE.

Credentials are expected to be portable. The application should take care to ensure that the data in value is portable. It is the responsibility of the application to define the byte-endian and alignment of the data in Value.
